other_tests.findings: Patient had a very high hostility score of 15 (maximum 23) at initial evaluation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Two months after treatment, the hostility score was 0, remained 0 two months later, and was 2 after five months.

other_tests.findings: The patient's hostility score was 16 during the evaluation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The hostility score dropped to 6 after treatment and remained the same three months later.

other_tests.findings: Patient reported episodes of anger attacks accompanied by autonomic arousal symptoms (tachycardia, sweating, flushing).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Marked improvement in symptoms observed after treatment with clomipramine.

other_tests.findings: Patient described episodes of anger that led to outbursts with autonomic symptoms.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After restarting clomipramine, the patient reported no anger attacks for the next four months.
